main event: A UFO sighting was reported near Corona del Mar, California on November 12, 1957. The witness observed a light crossing in front of the moon and tilting at a 45-degree angle to the right.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 3 seconds, and the object was described as resembling a huge cone or fin.
The witness observed the object moving fast from south to east, and it appeared to turn slightly before disappearing.
The letter accompanying the report requested a normal and logical explanation from the U.S. Air Forces, raising doubts about the nature of the sighting.
The report mentioned the presence of a maroon-black object and a dark, indistinct object near the light in the sky.
The UFO report was accompanied by a sketch showing the relative size of the object and its direction of motion, emphasizing that there were no nearby clouds and the object was well-defined.
sighted object: a light crossing in front of the moon and tilting at a 45-degree angle
